content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #91809 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?

I'm not yet sure if at this stage we can assign a priority. Issue reporter is experiencing a significant regression in compile time (which is bad) but it's not yet clear why. Investigation is in progress.
I think this could range from a P-medium (if turns out the issue is not specific to the Rust compile or can be circumvented by fiddling with the compile flags) to a P-high (if the cause of the regression can impact production code in another setup).
Perhaps the discussion could benefit from an MCVE. I'll try to ask for that (if it's possible for the issue reporter to isolate that from the whole code)

Now that I re-read it, I would say more P-medium, IIUC it's a regression in how the compiler handles recursive code crafted to be wrong. The regression is that previously the compilation loop was reported sooner
Perhaps I'm a bit confused but can the issue be closed now? Seems it does not reproduce on stable 1.57
